snippet: The head of the United Nations peacekeeping mission said that 8,000 fighters affiliated with a variety of armed factions had surrendered since the M23 rebel group was routed.
abstract: Martin Kobler, head of United Nations peacekeeping mission in Democratic Republic of Congo, says 8,000 fighters affiliated with variety of armed factions have surrendered since M23 rebel group was routed in November; members of Hutu militias are among those who have surrendered.
lead_paragraph: The head of the United Nations peacekeeping mission said that 8,000 fighters affiliated with a variety of armed factions had surrendered since the M23 rebel group was routed.
